column4: Hello. I have to move about 100 folders into one single folder. However, 6 out of these 100 folders need to stay and cannot be touched because they have very delicate permissions. Is there some way I can move ("mv") ALL (sudo mv *) folders into another folder but exclude some specific ones. For example ("sudo mv * /home/user1/ exclude examplefolder1, examplefolder2, examplefolder3)
simle loop script, for i in `ls | grep -v folder1 | grep -v folder2 | grep -v folder3` ; do ; mv $i $new_path; done
that will move everything except for folder1, ,2 and 3
so assume I am in the directory that has all the folders I want to move. I type: "sudo mv -r * | grep -v folder1 |  grep -v folder2 | grep -v folder3 ; do ; mv $i $/home/destinationfolder; done"
I told you a simple for loop
I've just given you the corect command
could you please expand I bit? I am lost. Thanks...
for i in `ls | grep -v ignore_dir | grep -v ignore_dir2` ; do mv $i /home/test/new/dir/$i ; done
thank you very much. I am going to do so now
